course.title: Hermeneutics and the Philology of the Flesh
course.description: The course offers an historical overview of theories of interpretation from Luther to Gadamer and Merleau-Ponty, with specific focus on metaphors of incarnation, embodiment, and revelation. In tracking the shift from interpretation as an auxiliary art to hermeneutics as a philosophical universal, the literary readings broach questions concerning theories of the verbal sign, understanding, self-consciousness, phenomenology, and the human condition - all in relation to the theological paradigms that have persistently motivated and shaped these investigations.
